intro: Pimpinele anisa, commonly known as wild anise, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic properties. Its seeds contain essential oils rich in anethole, contributing to its distinctive licorice-like fragrance. Pimpinele anisa thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
